docs.title: Gimbal Stabilization System
docs.text: This documentation describes the development of a 2/3-axis FPV gimbal for drone applications, focusing on precise stabilization and orientation feedback.

docs.title: 1. Purpose
docs.text: Define and implement a modular 2/3-axis FPV gimbal system for drones, providing high-precision camera stabilization and real-time orientation feedback to a flight controller.

docs.title: 2. Background
docs.text: Modern FPV drones often use fixed cameras or simple stabilization mounts. This project aims to create an open, extensible gimbal platform capable of: - accurate attitude tracking, - closed-loop control with BLDC motors, - feedback data exchange with flight controllers.

docs.title: 3. System Goals
docs.text:
• Provide stable camera orientation on 2 or 3 axes.
  • Measure angular position and velocity with high accuracy.
  • Communicate orientation data to a higher-level controller (e.g., FC).
  • Maintain low latency.
  • Support modular motor drivers and IMU sensors.
